Pad testing
Measurement of urine loss using an absorbent pad worn over a set period of time or during a protocol of 
physical exercise can be used to quantify the presence and severity of UI, as well as provide objective 
evidence of response to treatment.
A pad test can diagnose UI accurately.
Standardisation of bladder volume and degree of provocation improves reproducibility.

Twenty-four hours is sufficient duration for home-based testing balancing diagnostic accuracy and 
adherence.
Change in leaked urine volume on pad tests can be used to measure treatment outcome.

Pad tests can be a useful tool in the research setting and are an optional investigation in clinical 
practice.
